bibl.title: Letter from Henry Rose Carter to William Crawford Gorgas, January 5, 1920

div1.p: Carter discusses the strengths and weaknesses of Guiteras and White.

div1.head: Letter from Henry Rose Carter to William Crawford Gorgas, January 5, 1920
div1.opener:
ave's
gorgas
January 5, 1920.
General W. C. Gorgas,
The Highlands,
Washington, D. C.
Dear Doctor Gorgas:
div1.p: About Guiteras and White, I would put the matter thus:

Guiteras' knowledge of Spainish and of the Spainish-American
character and the fact that he is a Spainish-American himself, and
their best known authority on yellow fever, are decided assets--
assets which neither White nor myself possess--and for the kind
of work we were doing in 1916 I should think he would be of more
value to you than either White or myself. He has not had the
reputation of being a good organizer or a good executive--I have
never seen any of his work in these lines. White's work--organi-
zation and executive--at New Orleans in /05 was brilliant.

You know about how Guiteras is physically. He seemed about the
same last June as when he left us at Barbadoes. December /16, if
anything gentler and more kindly and courteous. We, Laura and I,
had him to dinner with us.
With best wishes from us all to you and yours,
